abstract.text: Stores the initial glyphs and glyph properties for a character range.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the layout managerâ€™s glyph cache.
A pointer to a buffer containing glyph properties for the glyphs in the cache.
A pointer to the starting index for the characters in the text storage for which glyphs are generated.
A font to override the font attributes in the text storage for the specified character range.
The range of glyphs in the glyph cache to set.
This method is invoked by text system during the glyph generation process. The only place apps are allowed to call this method directly is from an implementation of the
must be contiguous (no skipped indexes), enabling multiple items to have a same character index (as when one character index generates multiple glyph IDs). Due to font substitution,

passed into this method might not match the font in the attributes dictionary. Calling this method for a character range that has previously calculated layout information invalidates the layout and display.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
The representation of a font in an app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Glyph properties.
Returns the glyph at the specified index.
Returns the glyph at the specified index along with information about whether the glyph index is valid.
Returns the index in the text storage for the first character of the specified glyph.
Fills a passed-in buffer with a sequence of glyphs.
Returns the index of the first glyph of the character at the specified index.
Indicates whether the specified index refers to a valid glyph.
The number of glyphs in the layout manager.
Returns the glyph property of the glyph at the specified index.
Stores the initial glyphs and glyph properties for a character range.
Enables customization of the initial glyph generation process.
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
An index into the internal glyph table of a font.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A signed integer value type.
